metadata.title: Thursday, 17th March, 2022
metadata.session: FIRST SESSION OF THE THIRTEENTH ASSEMBLY

questions.minister: Minister of Local Government and Rural Development
parts: (a) what the progress, in percentage terms, on the construction of the mini civic centre in Kabwata Parliamentary Constituency was, as of October, 2021;
(b) what the cause of the delay in completing the project is; and
(c) when the construction works will be completed.
(a) whether the Government has any plans to review the mandate of the Food Reserve Agency to allow it to export maize instead of restricting it to procurement of the crop for strategic reserves; and
(b) if so, when the plans will be implemented.
(a) whether the Government has any plans to procure an additional ambulance suitable for the terrain of Solwezi East Parliamentary Constituency; and
(b) if so, when the plans will be implemented.

questions.minister: Minister of Infrastructure, Housing and Urban Development
parts: (a) why the rehabilitation of the Chikwa-Chasefu road in Chama South Parliamentary Constituency has stalled:
(b) when the works will resume;
(c) who the contractor for the project is;
(d) how much money was paid to the contractor, as of September, 2021;
(e) what the total cost of the project is; and
(f) what the time frame for the completion of the project is.

questions.minister: Minister of Education what measures the Government is taking to improve the School Feeding Programme in primary schools, countrywide.

parts: (a) whether the Government has any plans to construct a secondary school in Bwana Mkubwa Parliamentary Constituency;
(b) if so, when the plans will be implemented;
(c) what the estimated cost of the project is; and
(d) what the estimated time frame for the completion of the project is.
(a) how many dip tanks were earmarked for construction, under the programme for construction of dip tanks, province by province;
(b) how many dip tanks were completed, as of September, 2021;
(c) when the remaining dip tanks will be completed;
(d) what the cost of the dip tanks at (c) is;
(e) what the total cost of the project is;
(f) whether the programme has achieved its intended purpose so far; and
(g) if the purpose has not been achieved, why.

questions.minister: Minister of Infrastructure, Housing and Urban Development
parts: (a) why the construction of the District Administration block in Mulobezi District has stalled;
(b) when the project will resume;
(c) what the total cost of the project is; and

(d) what the time frame for the completion of the project is. ORDER OF THE DAY 1. Thanks – His Excellency the President’s Address – Motion (15th March) –  Resumption of Debate. __________________________
